perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Commerce One hereby grants to Corio a fee-bearing, perpetual and irrevocable, nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement), right and license in the Territory to (i) reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format only for installation on the Corio Servers; (ii) install multiple copies of the Software on Corio's Servers which will be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their subsequent use, (iii) permit limited access to and use of the Software and MarketSite.net Service by Customers through Corio Servers; (iv) sublicense an unlimited number of Customers to access and use the Software and MarketSite.net Service only through the installation on Corio servers; and (v) use Commerce One's tools and utilities, subject to any restrictions placed on the Commerce One by third party software providers, to modify and manage the Software. Except as specifically authorized by this Agreement, no license is granted under this Agreement to Corio to distribute the Software to its Customers or for use other than as part of the Corio Services.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Commerce One hereby grants to Corio a fee-bearing, nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement), right and license in the Territory to (i) reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format only for installation on the Corio Servers; (ii) install multiple copies of the Software on Corio's Servers which will be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their subsequent use, (iii) permit limited access to and use of the Software and MarketSite.net Service by Customers through Corio Servers; (iv) sublicense an unlimited number of Customers to access and use the Software and MarketSite.net Service only through the installation on Corio servers; and (v) use Commerce One's tools and utilities, subject to any restrictions placed on the Commerce One by third party software providers, to modify and manage the Software. Except as specifically authorized by this Agreement, no license is granted under this Agreement to Corio to distribute the Software to its Customers or for use other than as part of the Corio Services. This license is granted for the term of this agreement only, with no guarantee of renewal or extension.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the license is 'perpetual and irrevocable', creating a strong expectation of long-term rights. The modified text removes 'perpetual and irrevocable' and adds 'This license is granted for the term of this agreement only, with no guarantee of renewal or extension.' This directly contradicts the original implication, creating uncertainty about the duration of the license and the rights of Corio.

perturbation.original_text: Commerce One shall provide Corio with support described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Customers with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other third parties. Subject to Corio's payment of the annual support and maintenance fee, Commerce One's support and maintenance obligation of the Software and MarketSite.net Service shall continue after termination or expiration of this Agreement with respect to all Software Users granted access to the Software and MarketSite.net Service prior to termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Commerce One shall provide Corio with support described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Customers with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other third parties. Commerce One's support and maintenance obligations shall cease immediately upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, regardless of any prior commitments or existing Software Users. Continued support is subject to Commerce One's sole discretion and a separate agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that Commerce One's support continues after termination as long as Corio pays. The modified version directly contradicts this, stating support ceases upon termination. This creates confusion about the post-termination support obligations.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration for the licenses granted to Corio pursuant to Section 2 of this Agreement, Corio shall pay the license fees specified in EXHIBIT B hereto. Payment terms of such license fees shall be as set forth in EXHIBIT B hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for the licenses granted to Corio pursuant to Section 2 of this Agreement, Corio shall pay the license fees specified in EXHIBIT B hereto. All fees are subject to change at Commerce One's discretion with 30 days written notice. Payment terms of such license fees shall be as set forth in EXHIBIT B hereto.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a clear link between the license and the fixed fees in Exhibit B. By adding 'All fees are subject to change at Commerce One's discretion with 30 days written notice,' we create a contradiction. This allows Commerce One to unilaterally alter the fees, undermining the expectation of fixed costs based on the original agreement and EXHIBIT B.
